remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataViewRowState values are used either to retrieve a particular version of data from a <xref:System.Data.DataRow>, or to determine what versions exist.
Set the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.DataView> to specify which version or versions of data you want to view.
You can use the Boolean operator Or with the values to get more than one version.
The <xref:System.Data.DataTable> uses DataViewRowState in the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.Select%2A> method.
## Examples In the following example <xref:System.Data.DataTable> is created with a single column. The data is changed, and the <xref:System.Data.DataView.RowStateFilter%2A> of the <xref:System.Data.DataView> is set to display different row sets, depending on the DataViewRowState.
